background_description: The background consists of dry, light tan to light brown sandy or muddy ground, which is somewhat blurred in the distance. In the mid-ground and foreground, there are sparse clumps of green grass and small weeds, as well as a prominent dark brown, rough-textured log or piece of bark. Scattered dried plant debris and small stones are also visible on the ground.
camouflage_type: Color blending / Pattern matching / Shape disruption
explanation: The toad exhibits effective camouflage due to several factors. Its mottled green and brownish-grey skin coloration blends remarkably well with the surrounding environment. The green on its head and back matches the green blades of grass and weeds, while the brownish-grey patterns on its body integrate with the dark brown log it is resting behind and the earthy tones of the ground and dried debris. The rough, warty texture of the toad's skin closely mimics the irregular textures of the log, soil, and plant matter, further enhancing the blend. The toad's position, partially hidden behind the log, also helps to disrupt its overall shape, making it less discernible as a distinct organism. While its eyes are bright and somewhat stand out, the rest of its body creates low contrast against its immediate surroundings, making it difficult to spot.
